title: Viasat links up with Northrop Grumman for Air Force communications experiment
summary: The companies are working under the Defense Experimentation Using Commercial Space Internet (DEUCSI) program

title: Flight 2 Mishap Investigation closed as SpaceX preps for another WDR
summary: After the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) officially closed the mishap investigation into the second flight of Starship, which occurred on Nov 18, 2023. SpaceX is preparing to restack Booster 10 and Ship 28 onto the OLM before another Wet Dress Reheral WDR attempt that would set the stage for a March launch attempt.

title: Investing in Space: How Columbia’s fabric tech landed on the surface of the moon
summary: One theme I’m always keeping an eye on as a business reporter is whether companies outside the space sector are tapping the industry’s products, services or even just advertising opportunities. We’ve talked a lot about this topic in relation to space networks like GPS, communications and imagery – but last week’s historic moon landing represents yet another example.

title: Constellation primetime is MDA’s time to prime
summary: MDA chief executive Mike Greenley on the satellite-manufacturing transformation underway at Canada's space hardware specialist.

title: Space Force general warns of ‘window of vulnerability’ in satellite defense
summary: U.S. Space Command’s Gen. Stephen Whiting: “The PRC is moving breathtakingly fast in space”

title: China launches first high orbit internet satellite
summary: China launched the first of a new "high orbit" internet satellite series Thursday, apparently to provide internet services to China and surrounding areas.

title: NASA monitoring increased leak in Russian ISS module
summary: NASA says it is studying a long-running air leak on a Russian International Space Station module that recently doubled in magnitude, but that the leak does not currently pose a safety risk.

title: India targets uncrewed Gaganyaan orbital test mission in July, crewed flight in 2025
summary: India plans to conduct a first uncrewed orbital test flight for its Gaganyaan human spaceflight program in July this year.

title: Elve raises $15 million to speed up manufacturing of millimeter-wave amplifiers
summary: Elve, a startup manufacturing millimeter wave amplifiers for terrestrial and space applications, raised $15 million in a Series A investment round.

title: NASA AND IM AGREE: ODYSSEUS IS A SUCCESS
summary: Intuitive Machines’ Odysseus lunar lander, the first U.S. spacecraft to soft-land on the Moon in 52 years, is a success as far as the company and NASA are concerned. Despite […]
